security: Revealing that US officials made promises to Nagell that were not kept, and that he threatened to expose individuals within the organization if these promises were not honored, could damage relationships and reveal operational details. Specifically, “UNLESS PROMISES MADE TO HIM BY US OFFICIALS WERE HONORED HE WOULD REVEAL TO THE PRESS ENTIRE STORY OF HIS ALLEGED CONTACTS WITH WOF IRM AND WOULD EXPOSE INDIVIDUALS WITH WHOM HE HAD DEALT IN THE OR GAN IZ ATION.”
summary: A cable discusses Richard Case Nagell's threat to reveal his contacts with 'WOF IRM' and expose individuals within the organization if promises made by US officials are not honored, prompting a discussion on how to handle the situation, leaving it primarily to the consulate.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable, dated March 15, 1969, discusses Richard Case Nagell (also known as Joe Cramer, Joe Crane, and Robert C. Nolan) and his impending interview at the consulate. Nagell has threatened to disclose his contacts with 'WOF IRM' and expose individuals within the organization if US officials do not honor previous promises made to him. The base is inclined to leave the matter to the consulate unless otherwise advised, with reference to a State message from October 1968 from the US Mission in Berlin.
title: Richard Case Nagell's Threat to Expose Contacts
